Keep doing your thing gold bugs. I am a bitcoiner at heart but silverites just want inflation to get worse. Here is what happened in 1896;
‚ÄãGold Standard vs. Free Silver
‚ÄãThis was a battle over the money supply and who it should benefit:
‚ÄãThe Gold Standard: Supported by "Goldbugs" (bankers and industrialists). They wanted a fixed money supply to prevent inflation and keep the dollar stable, which favored creditors.
‚ÄãFree Silver: Supported by "Silverites" (farmers and miners). They wanted the unlimited coinage of silver at a 16:1 ratio to gold. This would increase the money supply, cause inflation, and make it easier for debtors to pay off loans.
If Bitcoin were to back the US dollar, we would essentially be returning to a "Hard Money" system, very similar to the Gold Standard.
In theory, moving to a Bitcoin Standard would be logistically "easier" than returning to a physical Gold Standard, but it would be economically much more volatile.
‚ÄãSince we are currently in 2026, the discussion around a "Strategic Bitcoin Reserve" has moved from fringe internet forums to actual policy debates in Washington.
